headline: Intuitive Surgical cut to sell at Deutsche Bank
summary: Investing.com -- In a note to clients Monday, analysts at Deutsche Bank cut their rating for Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) to Sell from Neutral, lowering their price target for the stock to $440 from $515 a share.

headline: Health Care Down on Medicaid Fears -- Health Care Roundup
summary: Health-care companies ticked down amid concerns about potential changes to Medicaid. Drug giant Merck said a new cholesterol-lowering pill worked well in two late-stage trials, boosting the stock...

headline: Why Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of medical technology company Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) fell 6.2% in the afternoon session after Deutsche Bank cut the stock's rating from Hold to Sell and slashed its price target to $440 from $515, after identifying accelerating competition from lower-cost remanufactured instruments in the Instruments & Accessories segment.

headline: AMD price target, Intuitive Surgical downgrade: Trending Tickers
summary: Citi analysts lifted their price target for Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to $120 from $100, highlighting potential positive catalysts in the second half of the year. Deutsche Bank downgraded Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) to Sell from Neutral and cut its price target for the company to $440. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.
